definition: to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: But Wang has insisted Zhang simply tripped, AFP reported.
sentences.chinese: 但法新社报道称，王坚持说张只是自己摔倒了。

sentences.english: Would you help a dirty migrant worker stand up when he falls down?
sentences.chinese: 当一个肮脏的民工摔倒时，你会去扶他站起来吗？

sentences.english: THE uncle had a great fall and is now in hospital nursing a fractured wrist.
sentences.chinese: 大叔摔倒了，现在在医院里，左手腕打着石膏。

sentences.english: Tell me, Huihua, how could people laugh when someone fell like that?
sentences.chinese: 慧华，告诉我，为什么人家摔倒了那些人还能笑出来？

sentences.english: Had taken a step big or it is easy to walk in footplate brim trip.
sentences.chinese: 迈步过大或踩在踏板边缘容易摔倒等。

sentences.english: She trusts you that you will hold her anyways when she is falling back.
sentences.chinese: 她相信在任何时候，当她要摔倒时，你都会扯住她。

sentences.english: and my friend Laura fell backwards, onto the wall.
sentences.chinese: 然后我朋友劳拉向后摔倒撞在了墙上。

sentences.english: He hit his forehead against the kerb when he fell.
sentences.chinese: 他摔倒时额头碰在了路边镶边石上。

sentences.english: He slumps to the ground a second time and stays down for more than a minute.
sentences.chinese: 他再一次摔倒在地，趟在地上一分多钟。

sentences.english: After his fall the boy rose and dusted himself down.
sentences.chinese: 男孩摔倒后爬起来把身上的灰拍掉。

sentences.english: Scott fell over and sprained his ankle .
sentences.chinese: 斯科特摔倒了，扭伤了踝骨。

sentences.english: I fell back in the ant pile.
Her leg suddenly gives way and she falls to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她两腿突然支持不住摔倒在地板上了。

sentences.english: Even ankle-high water, if it is moving, can make you fall.
sentences.chinese: 就算是及踝的水，只要是流动的，都可能让你摔倒。

sentences.english: At Rucker Chituodi a shoot him, wrestled to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 提托迪符拉克被他一拍，摔倒在地。

sentences.english: When he fell down, the other team started pelting him.
sentences.chinese: 他摔倒后，对方队伍开始猛烈攻击他。

definition: to slip (lose one's footing)
to injure oneself in a fall
to tumble/to fall/fig. to suffer a reverse (in politics or business)
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to trip/to stumble
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to trip and fall/to wrestle/wrestling (sports)
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to fall down/to take a fall
to fall to the ground
to knock sth over
high, lofty/precipitous
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
to fall and break/to break (bones) by falling
to fall flat on one's face (vulgar)
bruise/bump
